type2_diabetes.name: HbA1c (Glycated Hemoglobin)
type2_diabetes.why: Shows average blood sugar over past 3 months, best indicator of diabetes control

type2_diabetes.name: Fasting Blood Glucose
type2_diabetes.frequency: Annually or every 6 months if at risk
type2_diabetes.why: Measures blood sugar after overnight fasting, screens for diabetes

type2_diabetes.name: Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT)
type2_diabetes.why: Measures body's ability to process glucose, diagnostic test for diabetes

type2_diabetes.name: Lipid Profile
type2_diabetes.why: Diabetes increases cardiovascular risk; monitor cholesterol levels
type2_diabetes.normal_range: LDL <100 mg/dL, HDL >40 mg/dL, Triglycerides <150 mg/dL

cad.name: Lipid Profile (Complete)
cad.why: High cholesterol is major risk factor for coronary artery disease
cad.normal_range: Total <200 mg/dL, LDL <100 mg/dL, HDL >40 mg/dL, Triglycerides <150 mg/dL

cad.name: ECG (Electrocardiogram)
cad.why: Detects heart rhythm abnormalities and signs of previous heart damage
cad.normal_range: Normal sinus rhythm, no ST changes

cad.name: Stress Test (Exercise ECG)
cad.frequency: If symptoms present or high risk
cad.why: Evaluates heart function under stress, detects blocked arteries
cad.normal_range: No chest pain, normal BP response, no ST segment changes

cad.name: Coronary Calcium Score (CT)
cad.why: Measures calcium deposits in coronary arteries, predicts heart attack risk

cad.name: High-sensitivity CRP
cad.why: Inflammation marker associated with cardiovascular risk

hypertension.name: Blood Pressure Monitoring
hypertension.frequency: Weekly at home, every visit to doctor
hypertension.why: Essential for diagnosis and monitoring treatment effectiveness

hypertension.name: Basic Metabolic Panel
hypertension.frequency: Annually or when starting new medication
hypertension.why: Checks kidney function and electrolytes affected by BP medications

hypertension.name: Urinalysis
hypertension.why: Detects kidney damage from high blood pressure

hypertension.name: ECG
hypertension.why: Detects heart enlargement or damage from chronic hypertension
hypertension.normal_range: Normal sinus rhythm, no left ventricular hypertrophy

familial_hypercholesterolemia.name: Lipid Profile (Fasting)
familial_hypercholesterolemia.why: Monitor extremely high cholesterol levels requiring aggressive treatment
familial_hypercholesterolemia.normal_range: LDL <100 mg/dL (target <70 mg/dL for FH), Total <200 mg/dL

familial_hypercholesterolemia.name: Genetic Testing (LDLR, APOB, PCSK9)
familial_hypercholesterolemia.why: Confirms genetic mutation causing familial hypercholesterolemia
familial_hypercholesterolemia.normal_range: No pathogenic mutations (but FH patients will have mutations)

familial_hypercholesterolemia.name: ApoB (Apolipoprotein B)
familial_hypercholesterolemia.why: Better predictor of cardiovascular risk than LDL alone

familial_hypercholesterolemia.name: Coronary Calcium Score
familial_hypercholesterolemia.why: Early detection of atherosclerosis in young FH patients
familial_hypercholesterolemia.normal_range: 0 = no calcification, any score concerning in young adults

familial_hypercholesterolemia.name: Carotid Ultrasound
familial_hypercholesterolemia.why: Detects early atherosclerosis in neck arteries

breast_ovarian_cancer.name: BRCA1/BRCA2 Genetic Testing
breast_ovarian_cancer.why: Identifies inherited mutations that dramatically increase cancer risk
breast_ovarian_cancer.normal_range: No pathogenic variants (but high-risk families will often have mutations)

breast_ovarian_cancer.name: Mammogram
breast_ovarian_cancer.why: Screening for breast cancer, earlier detection saves lives

breast_ovarian_cancer.name: Breast MRI
breast_ovarian_cancer.frequency: Annually if BRCA+ or very high risk
breast_ovarian_cancer.why: More sensitive than mammogram for high-risk women

breast_ovarian_cancer.name: Transvaginal Ultrasound
breast_ovarian_cancer.why: Screens for ovarian cancer in BRCA+ women

breast_ovarian_cancer.name: CA-125 Blood Test
breast_ovarian_cancer.why: Tumor marker that may be elevated in ovarian cancer

thalassemia.name: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
thalassemia.why: Detects anemia and abnormal red blood cell characteristics

thalassemia.name: Hemoglobin Electrophoresis
thalassemia.frequency: Once for diagnosis, before family planning
thalassemia.why: Identifies thalassemia trait vs. disease, determines type

thalassemia.name: Genetic Testing/DNA Analysis
thalassemia.why: Confirms thalassemia mutations, guides family planning decisions
thalassemia.normal_range: No thalassemia mutations (but carriers will have mutations)

thalassemia.name: Iron Studies
thalassemia.why: Prevents iron overload in transfusion-dependent thalassemia

sickle_cell.name: Hemoglobin Electrophoresis
sickle_cell.why: Identifies sickle cell trait vs. disease
sickle_cell.normal_range: HbA >95%, no HbS (but carriers have HbAS, disease has HbSS)

sickle_cell.name: Genetic Testing/Counseling
sickle_cell.why: Determines carrier status, guides reproductive decisions
sickle_cell.normal_range: No sickle cell mutations (but carriers/patients will have mutations)

sickle_cell.name: Complete Blood Count
sickle_cell.frequency: Regularly if disease, annually if carrier
sickle_cell.why: Monitors anemia severity in sickle cell disease

sickle_cell.name: Reticulocyte Count
sickle_cell.why: Measures bone marrow response to anemia

asthma.name: Spirometry (Lung Function Test)
asthma.why: Measures airflow obstruction, confirms asthma diagnosis

asthma.name: Peak Flow Monitoring
asthma.why: Home monitoring of lung function, detects worsening early

asthma.name: Allergy Testing (Skin/Blood)
asthma.why: Identifies allergens that trigger asthma attacks

hypothyroidism.name: TSH (Thyroid Stimulating Hormone)
hypothyroidism.frequency: Annually or every 6 months if on medication
hypothyroidism.why: Primary test for thyroid function, elevated in hypothyroidism

hypothyroidism.name: Free T4 (Thyroxine)
hypothyroidism.frequency: If TSH abnormal or on medication

hypothyroidism.name: Free T3 (Triiodothyronine)
hypothyroidism.frequency: If symptoms persist despite normal TSH/T4

pcos.name: Pelvic Ultrasound
pcos.why: Visualizes polycystic ovaries, rules out other conditions

pcos.name: Testosterone (Total and Free)
pcos.why: Elevated androgens are diagnostic criterion for PCOS
pcos.normal_range: Total <50 ng/dL, Free <2.5 pg/mL (varies by lab)

pcos.name: Fasting Glucose and Insulin
pcos.why: PCOS increases diabetes risk due to insulin resistance

pcos.name: Lipid Profile
pcos.why: PCOS associated with dyslipidemia and cardiovascular risk
pcos.normal_range: LDL <100 mg/dL, HDL >40 mg/dL, Triglycerides <150 mg/dL
